required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Dose-effect of a New Fermented Food in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Tolerance of a New Fermented Food in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to assess the safety and tolerance of a new fermented food versus a control product in healthy adults during the 4-week consumption period.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on adverse events.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: Number of Adverse events, number of AE related to product, number of emergent AE, number of mild/moderate and severe AE, number of serious AE.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product vital signs.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product vital signs.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product vital signs.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on hematology.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on hematology.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on hematology.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: Red blood cell, white blood cell, platelets (count/L).

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on glucose and lipids metabolism.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: blood glucose (mmol/L), lipids [total cholesterol, HDL, LDL, triglycerides] (mmol/L).

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on liver function.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: Blood alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, gamma-glutamyltransferase (IU/L).

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on kidney function.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on thyroid function.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on blood marker of inflammation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on fecal marker of inflammation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on bowel habits.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: Stool frequency and consistency (Bristol Stool Scale from 1 [hard stools] to 7 [watery stools]).

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on digestive symptoms.
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of abdominal pain/discomfort, abdominal bloating, flatulence, borborygmi/rumbling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on adverse events.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week follow-up period and the 8-week entire study period.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Adverse events, number of AE related to product, number of emergent AE, number of mild/moderate and severe AE, number of serious AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on test product strains detection and quantification in feces.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption and after 4-week follow-up period.
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of test product bacterial strains in feces by quantitative PCR (bacterial cells/g of feces).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on microbiota analysis in feces.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption and after 4-week follow-up period.
secondary_outcome.description: Gut microbiota analysis by sequencing approaches (16S rRNA and shotgun sequencing): Alpha (index) and beta-diversity (distance).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 1 bottle/day of test versus control product on microbiota analysis in feces.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption and after 4-week follow-up period.
secondary_outcome.description: Gut microbiota analysis by sequencing approaches (16S rRNA and shotgun sequencing): relative abundance of bacterial genera (%) and metabolic pathways (%).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 3 bottles/day of test versus control product on test product strains detection and quantification in feces.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption and after 4-week follow-up period.
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of test product bacterial strains in feces by quantitative PCR (bacterial cells/g of feces).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 3 bottles/day of test versus control product on microbiota analysis in feces.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption and after 4-week follow-up period.
secondary_outcome.description: Gut microbiota analysis by sequencing approaches (16S rRNA and shotgun sequencing): Alpha (index) and beta-diversity (distance).

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of 3 bottles/day of test versus control product on microbiota analysis in feces.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-week period of product consumption and after 4-week follow-up period.
secondary_outcome.description: Gut microbiota analysis by sequencing approaches (16S rRNA and shotgun sequencing): relative abundance of bacterial genera (%) and metabolic pathways (%).

arm_group.description: Fermented dairy product containing probiotics - normal dose
Fermented dairy product containing probiotics - high dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects after receiving a full description of the study, provide written informed consent to take part in the study.
- Free-living subject, as evaluated during the clinical examination.
- Male/female subjects aged between 18 to 55 years (bounds included).
- Subjects with a body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 ≤ BMI < 30kg/m².
- Healthy subjects (as determined by a medical examination)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with any allergy (food, respiratory…).
- Subjects that have had any surgery or intervention requiring general anaesthesia in the last 4 weeks.
- Subjects with a history of chronic metabolic or gastrointestinal disease with the exception of appendectomy.
- Subjects with chronic or iatrogenic immunodeficiency (e.g. Chemotherapy, HIV).
- Subjects presenting a severe evolutive or chronic pathology (e.g. cancer,tuberculosis, Crohn's disease, cirrhosis, multiple sclerosis, Type I diabetes…).
- Subject with eating disorders.
- Subjects with cardiac, respiratory (including asthma) or renal insufficiency, cardiomyopathy, valvulopathy and medical history of rheumatic fever.
- Subjects with special medicated diet (for obesity, anorexia, metabolic pathology…).
- For female subjects: pregnancy, breast-feeding or not willing to use/not using an acceptable method of contraception
- Subject, in the Investigator's opinion, should not be randomised.

facility.name: Harrison Clinical Research Clinical Unit, Hilblestrasse 54
